author: John Doe
title: Sachin Tendulkar
content: Sachin Tendulkar, known as the 'Little Master,' is widely regarded as one of the greatest batsmen in the history of cricket. He holds numerous records including the most runs in both Test and ODI cricket.
board: Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI)

author: Jane Smith
title: Virat Kohli
content: Virat Kohli is one of the modern greats of the game, known for his aggressive batting style and exceptional consistency. He has been a prolific run-scorer across all formats and has led India to many memorable victories.
board: Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI)

author: Robert Brown
title: Brian Lara
content: Brian Lara is celebrated for his elegant stroke play and is considered one of the finest left-handed batsmen of all time. He holds the record for the highest individual score in a Test inning, with 400 not out.

author: Emily White
title: Jacques Kallis
content: Jacques Kallis is widely regarded as one of the greatest all-rounders in cricket history. He excelled with both bat and ball, amassing over 10,000 runs and 250 wickets in both Test and ODI formats.

author: Michael Green
title: Ricky Ponting
content: Ricky Ponting, one of Australia's finest captains, led his team to multiple World Cup victories. A prolific batsman, Ponting is known for his aggressive style and sharp cricketing mind.

author: Sarah Blue
title: Kumar Sangakkara
content: Kumar Sangakkara, one of Sri Lanka's greatest cricketers, is renowned for his elegant batting and sharp wicket-keeping. He has scored over 12,000 runs in both Test and ODI cricket.

author: David Yellow
title: Shane Warne
content: Shane Warne, the legendary Australian leg-spinner, is widely regarded as one of the greatest bowlers in the history of cricket. His incredible skill and charisma made him a fan favorite.

author: Laura Black
title: AB de Villiers
content: AB de Villiers, known as 'Mr. 360' for his ability to play shots all around the wicket, is one of the most versatile and explosive batsmen in modern cricket. His innovative batting has redefined the game.

author: Mark Red
title: Muttiah Muralitharan
content: Muttiah Muralitharan, the Sri Lankan off-spinner, holds the record for the most wickets in both Test and ODI cricket. His unique bowling action and incredible spin made him a formidable opponent.

author: Lucy Purple
title: Viv Richards
content: Viv Richards, the legendary West Indian batsman, is known for his dominant and fearless batting style. He was a key player in the West Indies' domination of world cricket in the 1970s and 1980s.
